a type of thin, flat bread, made especially in Jewish cooking, and eaten especially during Passover: At Passover, leavened bread is replaced by unleavened breads, such as matzo. Every year, she makes fresh matzah with her dad. a box of matzos One piece of matza was wrapped up and hidden somewhere in the room during the meal. Dip the matzohs into milk and lift out before they become soft.
